intro: Campylocentrum parahybunense var. gracile, commonly known as the slender starfruit, is a tropical plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and edible, star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the Atlantic Forest biome. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, while its stems are woody and often branched. The fruit, which is yellow when ripe, has a unique flavor and is used both for culinary and ornamental purposes.
